intro: Didymocarpus mollis, commonly known as the soft-fruited hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers with five petals. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its foliage is dense and can be used in ornamental gardening.
